intro: Cephaelis yapoensis, commonly known as the Yapo mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and mountainous areas. Cephaelis yapoensis is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
